alert.note: Alert for Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 25 at 9:23AM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Little Bighorn River Near Hardin affecting Big Horn County. .Recent heavy rainfall will bring rises to near flood stage over the next few days. In addition, high flows on the Bighorn River may back up the Little Bighorn River at the confluence causing flooding in the Hardin vicinity. Whether flooding develops will depend on additional rainfall upstream over the next few days along with any additional increases in flow on the Bighorn River this week. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Little Bighorn River near Hardin. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low lying areas along the river, especially at the confluence with the Bighorn River near Hardin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Little Bighorn River Hardin 8.0 6.6 Sun 8 am 7.6 6.4 6.0 &&
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means that flooding is possible. Now is the time to prepare for action in the event flooding occurs. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning by 930 AM MDT.
